mcq.question: When was Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha founded?
mcq.explanation: Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha was founded in 1836 in Calcutta by associates of Raja Rammohan Roy.

mcq.question: Who were associates of Raja Rammohan Roy in founding Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha?
options: Prasanna Kumar Thakur, Dwarkanath Tagore, Kalisanth Chowdhury
mcq.explanation: Associates included Prasanna Kumar Thakur, Kalisanth Chowdhury, Dwarkanath Tagore, Gouri Sankar Bhattacharya, and Durga Prasad Tarka Panchanan.

mcq.question: What did Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha advocate?
options: Administrative reforms, Indian participation in governance, educational advancement
mcq.explanation: Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha advocated administrative reforms, Indian participation in governance, and educational advancement.

mcq.question: Which was the first association to initiate constitutional agitation in India?
mcq.explanation: Zamindari Association (1837) was the first to initiate constitutional agitation in India while protecting landlord interests.

mcq.question: What was Zamindari Association also known as?
mcq.explanation: Zamindari Association was also known as Landholders' Society, founded in Calcutta in 1837.

mcq.question: Who founded Bengal British India Society (1843)?
options: George Thompson, Dwarkanath Tagore, Chandra Mohan Chatterjee, Parmananda Maitra
mcq.explanation: Bengal British India Society (1843) was founded by George Thompson, Dwarkanath Tagore, Chandra Mohan Chatterjee, and Parmananda Maitra.

mcq.question: Who was President of British Indian Association (1851)?
mcq.explanation: Radhakant Deb was President of British Indian Association (1851), with Debendranath Tagore as General Secretary.

mcq.question: British Indian Association petitioned for what? (UPSC 2017)
mcq.explanation: British Indian Association petitioned for Universities in three Presidencies among other reforms (UPSC 2017 mention).

mcq.question: Who founded Bombay Association (1852)?
mcq.explanation: Bombay Association (1852) was founded by Jagannath Shankarsheth.

mcq.question: Who revived Bombay Association in 1876?
mcq.explanation: Dadabhai Naoroji revived Bombay Association in 1876; it was later overshadowed by newer groups.

mcq.question: First political association of Madras Presidency?
mcq.explanation: Madras Native Association (MNA) in 1852 was the first political association of Madras Presidency.

mcq.question: Who founded East India Association in London (1866)?
mcq.explanation: Dadabhai Naoroji founded East India Association in London in 1866.

mcq.question: When was Poona Sarvajanik Sabha founded?
mcq.explanation: Poona Sarvajanik Sabha was founded in 1867 in Poona.

mcq.question: When did M.G. Ranade join Poona Sarvajanik Sabha?
mcq.explanation: M.G. Ranade joined Poona Sarvajanik Sabha in 1871.

mcq.question: Who founded Indian League (1875)?
mcq.explanation: Indian League (1875) in Calcutta was founded by Sisir Kumar Ghosh.

mcq.question: Who founded Indian Association (1876)? (UPSC 2017)
mcq.explanation: Indian Association (1876) in Calcutta was founded by Surendranath Banerjee and Ananda Mohan Bose (UPSC 2017).

mcq.question: Indian Association organised what conference in 1883?
mcq.explanation: Indian Association organised the All-India Conference in 1883, first attempt at all-India political coordination.

mcq.question: When did All-India Conference merge with INC?
mcq.explanation: The All-India Conference (1883) later merged with INC in 1886.

mcq.question: When was Madras Mahajan Sabha founded?
mcq.explanation: Madras Mahajan Sabha was founded in Madras in 1884.

mcq.question: Who founded Madras Mahajan Sabha?
options: M. Veeraraighavachari, P. Ananda Charlu, G. Subramania Iyer
mcq.explanation: Madras Mahajan Sabha (1884) was founded by M. Veeraraighavachari, P. Ananda Charlu, and G. Subramania Iyer.

mcq.question: When was Bombay Presidency Association founded?
mcq.explanation: Bombay Presidency Association was founded in Bombay in 1885.

mcq.question: Bombay Presidency Association was formed in response to?
options: Lytton's policies and Ilbert Bill controversy
mcq.explanation: Bombay Presidency Association (1885) was formed in response to Lytton's policies and Ilbert Bill controversy.

mcq.question: Which association had strong ties with Poona Sarvajanik Sabha?
mcq.explanation: Bombay Presidency Association (1885) maintained strong ties with Poona Sarvajanik Sabha.

mcq.question: When was London Indian Society founded?
mcq.explanation: London Indian Society was founded in London in 1885 by Dadabhai Naoroji.

mcq.question: London Indian Society was later absorbed into?
mcq.explanation: London Indian Society (1885) was later absorbed into East India Association.

comprehensive.question: Trace the evolution of political associations from early reform-focused groups (1836-1852) to more nationalist organizations (1876-1885), analyzing the shift in goals and methods.
comprehensive.answer: Early Period (1836-1852) - Reform Focus: Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha (1836): Associates of Raja Rammohan Roy advocated administrative reforms, Indian participation in governance, educational advancement. Reformist, within system.

comprehensive.question: Analyze the geographic distribution of political associations (Calcutta, Bombay, Madras, Poona, London) and what this pattern reveals about nationalist development in different regions.
comprehensive.answer: Calcutta Dominance (1836-1876): 1836: Bangabhasha Prakasika Sabha, 1837: Zamindari Association, 1843: Bengal British India Society, 1851: British Indian Association, 1875: Indian League, 1876: Indian Association. Six major associations in 40 years. Why Calcutta?

comprehensive.question: Examine the key figures across associations (Dwarkanath Tagore, Dadabhai Naoroji, Surendranath Banerjee) and analyze how individuals connected multiple organizations, creating networks that enabled eventual formation of INC.
comprehensive.answer: Multi-Association Figures - Network Builders: Dwarkanath Tagore: Zamindari Association (1837), Bengal British India Society (1843). Span: Early period (1837-43), connecting landlord interests (Zamindari) with broader welfare (Bengal British India Society).
